metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13935 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The payload length in a WebSocket frame was not correctly validated inApache Tomcat 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M6, 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.36, 8.5.0 to 8.5.56and 7.0.27 to 7.0.104. Invalid payload lengths could trigger an infiniteloop. Multiple requests with invalid payload lengths could lead to a denialof service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat8 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13').
